example: Consumers compare commodity prices and decide which commodities to buy.
Consumers and producers use prices to make decisions.
Price is an important factor when people buy and sell.
If the price is very low, many people want to buy it, but producers don’t want to produce much. This is a shortage.
If the price is very high, producers want to produce a lot, but consumers don’t want to buy much. This is a surplus.
Commodities such as water, electricity and gas are called public services.
